data.title: [GWT] WebGL low frame rate.
data.body:
After fix error, fps increases from 11 to 29, and from 20 to 60.

#### Issue details
GwtGL20 in backend-gwt have function glGetError. Seems it is incredible slow operation for WebGL, without any gl errors. For fix need hardcode return 0; without call native function.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.5

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [x] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: MOE FileHandle.list() always return empty array
TextField crash when writing brackets if color markup is enabled
RoboVM: audio doesn't pause when app goes to background
data.body:
#### Reproduction steps/code
1. start playing something with newMusic
2. pause app (press home button)

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
gdxVersion = '1.9.5'
roboVMVersion = '2.3.0'

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] iOS (RoboVM)

data.title: MOE and FreeType fonts: Couldn't load shared library
data.body:
With RoboVm everything works as expected.

#### Reproduction steps/code
```java
project(":krq-player-ios-moe") {
    apply plugin: "java"
    apply plugin: "kotlin"
    apply plugin: "moe"

    configurations { natives }

    dependencies {
        compile project(":krq-player-core")

        compile "org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-stdlib:$kotlin_version"

        compile 'org.slf4j:slf4j-simple:1.7.12'
        
        compile "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-backend-moe:$gdxVersion"
        natives "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-platform:$gdxVersion:natives-ios"
        natives "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-freetype-platform:$gdxVersion:natives-ios"
    }
}
```

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.5

#### Stacktrace
```java
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Couldn't load shared library 'gdx-freetype' for target: Darwin, 32-bit
	at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.load(SharedLibraryLoader.java:119)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.freetype.FreeType.initFreeType(FreeType.java:887)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.freetype.FreeTypeFontGenerator.<init>(FreeTypeFontGenerator.java:94)
	at red.kometa.quest.player.utils.gdxsmartfont.SmartFontGenerator.generateFontWriteFiles(SmartFontGenerator.java:81)
	at red.kometa.quest.player.utils.gdxsmartfont.SmartFontGenerator.createFont(SmartFontGenerator.java:70)
	at red.kometa.quest.player.presentation.Fonts.generateFont(Fonts.kt:107)
	at red.kometa.quest.player.presentation.Fonts.generateFont(Fonts.kt:88)
	at red.kometa.quest.player.presentation.Fonts.access$generateFont(Fonts.kt:28)
	at red.kometa.quest.player.presentation.Fonts$generateFonts$1.call(Fonts.kt:77)
```

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] iOS (MOE)

data.title: Intel Multi-OS Engine and SimpleXML crash
data.body:
On RoboVm SimpleXML works without any problem.

#### Reproduction steps/code
This code running on separate thread. (rx-java, io-scheduler)
```java
val questFile = gdxContext.files.internal("quest.xml")
xmlSerializer.read(Quest::class.java, questFile.reader())
```

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
libgdx 1.9.5
org.multi-os-engine:moe-gradle:1.3.0-beta-2
org.simpleframework:simple-xml:2.7.1

data.title: Desktop/Win7: Gdx.input.isKeyPressed(Keys.BACK) is TRUE, when I change the volume!?
data.body:
I would like to report a very strange problem:
I'm using a Logitech G-110 keyboard. The keyboard has a volume-wheel and a mute button.
When used, the volume will be changed in Windows (as expected). This works in/from every app without any problems.

But when my LibGdx-app is running and I use the wheel OR the key, Gdx.input.isKeyPressed(Keys.BACK) will be true! This results in unwanted behaviour, because my code then calls the previous screen (this is actually implemented for android).

To fix this, I now ignore the Back-Key on Desktop, but nevertheless I wanted to report this bug/strange behavior.

OS: Windows 7
Libgdx: 1.9.5

data.title: ARM/RPI Support for GDX Headless
data.body:
I am working on setting up a Jenkins server to run all my unit tests on a Raspberry Pi 3 I have. Everything works flawlessly up until my unit tests need to reference GDX elements (mocked or otherwise). I understand the in theory LibGDX is not meant for the Pi family, but being able to at least support it headless would be amazing for hobbyists like myself.

#### Issue details
Currently when I run my test project on Raspbian with Jenkins I get:
~~~~
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Couldn't load shared library 'libgdxarmgnueabihf.so' for target: Linux, 32-bit
~~~~

#### Reproduction steps/code
1. Get a Raspi 3
2. Install Rasbian
3. Install Android Studio
4. Using the SDK Manager install the necessary versions of dependencies (https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/versions.html)
5. Setup a GDX project and some unit tests (https://github.com/TomGrill/gdx-testing for instructions)
6. Run your tests

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
LibGDX: 1.9.5
Raspbian:  4.4.26-v7+
Raspi: 3

#### Stacktrace
```java
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Couldn't load shared library 'libgdxarmgnueabihf.so' for target: Linux, 32-bit
	at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.load(SharedLibraryLoader.java:119)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxNativesLoader.load(GdxNativesLoader.java:33)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.headless.HeadlessNativesLoader.load(HeadlessNativesLoader.java:24)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.headless.HeadlessApplication.<init>(HeadlessApplication.java:66)
	at com.philiproyer.battleroom.tests.GdxTestRunner.<init>(GdxTestRunner.java:40)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:45)
	at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:422)
```

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

Potential people for input: @TomGrill (https://github.com/TomGrill/gdx-testing) @natdan (https://github.com/natdan/rpi-libgdx-example)

data.title: Problems with a BitmapFont generated by Hiero
Add getters and setters to Rectangle class for its sides (top, right, bottom, left)
data.body:
Add methods to Rectangle class for getting and setting its sides and center (without the need to pass a Vector param).

I've added this as I found useful said methods on MonoGame's Rectangle2D class and decided to port said functionality to libgdx while I'm working a port from MonoGame to libgdx after doing a Coursera course.

I still need to sign the CLA but as I'm not sure if this fits in the project, I'm asking beforehand to avoid lost time :)

data.title: SVG support for libgdx
data.body: Are there future plans to integrate SVGs into libgdx? The font rendering already allows the rendering of fonts to a `Texture`, however I could not find any information about rendering .svg files to a texture, including scaling and resizing.

data.title: Fixed KTXProcessor in gdx-tools never exiting.
data.body: When running KTXProcessor, the process would never exit, eventhough the conversion went fine. This PR fixes this issue.

data.title: raw overlaps to avoid unnecessary object creation
static overlaps for Rectangle
Added support for Multi-OS Engine 1.3.0-beta-2
data.body:
[general]
- Updated moe-core and moe-ios jars to ones from MOE 1.3.0-beta-2
- Minor code cleanup
- Updated MOE versions to 1.3.0-beta-2
- Fixed bug in SharedLibraryLoader caused by change in MOE

[gdx-setup]
- Updated project files in GdxSetup.java
- Template build.gradle was updated and now properly handles resources via "ASSET_PATH"
- Deprecated files were removed
- Default and Icon images were moved to the appropriate location (Xcode target's folder)
- Updated Xcode project's layout

[test]
- Updated MOE test project
- Test now runs BulletTestCollection

data.title: TexturePacker, allow user to set the amount of bleed iterations.
data.body:
Currently TextureAtlas performs 2 iterations to bleed colored pixels to transparent ones, but this is not enough when a MipMapLinearLinear filtering is used, leaving white artifacts in the final result.

This PR exposes the amount of iterations to the user, so they can perform 2, 4, or even 8 iterations if they want to, while keeping the default value unchanged.

data.title: "Auto Scrolling" TextArea removes first line instead of just growing
Default gitignore is too restrictive
data.body:
gitignore file generated by gdx setup have undesirable side effects : any folder you want to track with git (including java package) which is named "war", "build", "out" or "bin" will be ignored. Note that I discovered this issue creating a "war" game with a "war" package name somewhere, so other developers  may face the same problem.

IMO best practice is to avoid recursive path in gitignore as much as possible (all path without a leading slash are processed recursively).

My proposal would be to keep some global recursive ignore in the root file (*.class, *.project ...) and dispatch specific parts to related sub-project : For instance, "war/" would be replaced by "/war" and moved to web sub-project.

What do you think ?

data.title: added newEmitter method
data.body:
This makes it easier for subclasses of ParticleEffect to create custom
emitters.

data.title: SequenceAction: unusable without an actor
data.body:
I don't use Actors in my current project, but I do use Actions and Pools. So far I've been successful in using `FloatAction` and `ColorAction` without attaching Actors to them -- that is I call `act(delta)` directly and get the values from the actions. 
However it's different with `SequesceAction`: if I don't set an actor it will always execute only the first action and ignore the rest. From `SequenceAction.act(delta)`:

```
...
if (actions.get(index).act(delta)) {
	if (actor == null) return true; // This action was removed.
...
```
My understanding was that some Actions are intended to be actor-agnostic (at least I can see an effort to make them like that). Why is it different with `SequenceAction`? If I can use `ColorAction` without attaching an actor to it I should be able to chain several `ColorAction`s using `SequenceAction`, still without attaching an actor, no?

data.title: "News" page of official site is empty

[https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/news.html](https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/news.html)

It's empty for a long time.

data.title: PolygonSprite minor improvements
data.body:
I removed a couple of redundant lines (I'll explain below) and added an optimization when setting a new region.

Resolves #3722 by correcting the docs for the `getColor` methods. I didn't simply say "don't modify the returned color" because it would be valid to pass the color back into `setColor`, which might be convenient if doing some sort of transformation on the existing color.

data.title: No error catching for wrong position
Couldn't load shared library 'gdx64.dll' for target: Windows 10, 64-bit
data.body: how to fix it?

data.title: PixmapPacker.pack method may change Pixmap.Blending value
data.body:
#### Issue details
Running multiple instances of `PixmapPacker` on background thread may change `Pixmap.Blending` value to `Pixmap.Blending.None`.
This is caused by `PixmapPacker.pack` method changing `Pixmap.Blending` which is global state: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/1.9.5/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g2d/PixmapPacker.java#L174

#### Reproduction steps/code
Run multiple instances on PixmapPacker on background thread. Eventually `Pixmap.Blending` will be changed to `Pixmap.Blending.None`.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.x

#### Please select the affected platforms
Probably all of them, observed on android and iOS.
- [x] Android
- [x] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: Sprite from a rotated placement in an atlas doesn't appear to flip correctly
data.body:
#### Issue details
I have an image in a texture atlas that is rotated to help save space (90 counter clockwise). When a sprite is created the AtlasSprite class correctly re-rotates it back, however if I then try to flip the sprite on the x-axis it is incorrectly flipped on the y axis instead. This issue doesn't occur if the sprite is not rotated.

I am currently going through the Sprite and AtlasSprite code to see if I can find the issue

#### Reproduction steps/code
Use an image that is rotated in an atlas
Create a sprite from the texture atlas
Use setFlip(true,false) and it will be upside down

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.5

data.title: Reset renderable.userData in RenderablePool
data.body:
This pull request changes ModelBatch.RenderablePool.obtain() and RenderableShapeBuilder.RenderablePool.obtain() to reset renderable.userData as currently it is not reset.

[Forum post](http://badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=25563)

data.title: Why does Timer thread sometimes not get started when starting an app in Libgdx?
data.body:
Please ensure you have given all the following requested information in your report.

#### Issue details
_Please provide the details of your issue_

Sometimes when my Activity gets started, the Libgdx's Timer thread is not started at all (I figured this out by attaching a breakpoint) and all the timer functionalities don't work (https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/nightlies/docs/api/com/badlogic/gdx/utils/Timer.html). This doesn't happen consistently. Is this a known bug?
